result.markdown:
--- title: "Week 7 figures - Lectures 12 and 13" editor: source freeze: auto execute: message: false warning: false format: html: code-fold: true author: - name: An Bui url: https://an-bui.com/ affiliation: UC Santa Barbara, Ecology, Evolution, and Marine Biology affiliation-url: https://www.eemb.ucsb.edu/ published-title: "Lecture date" date: 2024-05-13 date-modified: last-modified categories: [linear models] citation: url: https://spring-2024.envs-193ds.com/lecture/lecture_week-07.html --- ## 0. Set up ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # cleaning library(tidyverse) # visualization theme_set(theme_classic() + theme(panel.grid = element_blank(), axis.text = element_text(size = 18), axis.title = element_text(size = 18), text = element_text(family = "Lato"))) library(patchwork) library(ggeffects) library(flextable) library(modelsummary) library(gtsummary) # analysis library(car) library(performance) library(broom) ``` ::: ## 1. Math ### a. Residuals Residuals are the difference between the actual observed value ($y_i$) and the model prediction ($\hat{y}$) at some value of $x$. $$ residual = y_i - \hat{y} $$ Ordinary least squares minimizes the sum of squares of the residuals. ### b. Model equations OLS gives you an equation for a line. $$ \begin{align} y &= b + mx \\ y &= \beta_0 + \beta_1x + \epsilon \\ \end{align} $$ $\beta$ terms ("betas") are often referred to as "model coefficients". ### c. Mathematical hypothesis Statistically, the hypotheses are: H_0_: the predictor variable does not predict the response H_A_: the predictor variable does predict the response Mathematically, you might express that as: $$ H_0: \beta_1 = 0 \\ H_A: \beta_1 \neq 0 $$ ### d. R2 $$ \begin{align} R^2 &= 1 - \frac{\sum_{i = 1}^{n}(y_i - \hat{y})^2}{\sum_{i = 1}^{n}(y_i - \bar{y})^2} \\ &= 1 - \frac{SS_{residuals}}{SS_{total}} \end{align} $$ ### e. Pearson's correlation ## formula for Pearson's correlation $$ r = \frac{\sum(x_i - \bar{x})(y_i - \bar{y})}{\sqrt{\sum(x_i-\bar{x})^2}\sqrt{\sum(y_i - \bar{y})^2}} $$ ## test statistic for pearson correlation $$ \begin{align} t &= \frac{r\sqrt{n - 2}}{\sqrt{1-r^2}} \\ df &= n -2 \end{align} $$ ## 2. R2 ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} df <- tibble( x = seq(from = 1, to = 20, by = 1), r2_1 = 3*x + 1, r2_between = runif(n = 20, min = 1, max = 5)*x + runif(n = 20, min = 1, max = 5), r2_0 = runif(n = 20, min = 1, max = 20) ) lm(r2_1 ~ x, data = df) %>% summary() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Call: lm(formula = r2_1 ~ x, data = df) Residuals: Min 1Q Median 3Q Max -3.676e-15 -1.312e-15 -5.240e-17 8.432e-16 7.220e-15 Coefficients: Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|) (Intercept) 1.000e+00 1.142e-15 8.757e+14 <2e-16 *** x 3.000e+00 9.532e-17 3.147e+16 <2e-16 *** --- Signif. codes: 0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 Residual standard error: 2.458e-15 on 18 degrees of freedom Multiple R-squared: 1, Adjusted R-squared: 1 F-statistic: 9.905e+32 on 1 and 18 DF, p-value: < 2.2e-16 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(df, aes(x = x, y = r2_1)) + geom_point(size = 3) + geom_smooth(method = "lm") ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](lecture_week-07_files/figure-html/r2-1-1.png){width=672} ::: ```{.r .cell-code} lm(r2_between ~ x, data = df) %>% summary() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Call: lm(formula = r2_between ~ x, data = df) Residuals: Min 1Q Median 3Q Max -26.9586 -8.2880 -0.1051 5.7411 24.7204 Coefficients: Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|) (Intercept) 1.755 6.325 0.277 0.785 x 2.664 0.528 5.046 8.41e-05 *** --- Signif. codes: 0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 Residual standard error: 13.62 on 18 degrees of freedom Multiple R-squared: 0.5858, Adjusted R-squared: 0.5628 F-statistic: 25.46 on 1 and 18 DF, p-value: 8.414e-05 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(df, aes(x = x, y = r2_between)) + geom_point(size = 3) + geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = FALSE) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](lecture_week-07_files/figure-html/r2-1-2.png){width=672} ::: ```{.r .cell-code} lm(r2_0 ~ x, data = df) %>% summary() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Call: lm(formula = r2_0 ~ x, data = df) Residuals: Min 1Q Median 3Q Max -8.4344 -3.7276 -0.4751 4.3101 7.6648 Coefficients: Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|) (Intercept) 5.5938 2.1571 2.593 0.0184 * x 0.4075 0.1801 2.263 0.0362 * --- Signif. codes: 0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 Residual standard error: 4.644 on 18 degrees of freedom Multiple R-squared: 0.2215, Adjusted R-squared: 0.1782 F-statistic: 5.121 on 1 and 18 DF, p-value: 0.03624 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(df, aes(x = x, y = r2_0)) + geom_point(size = 3) + geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = FALSE) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](lecture_week-07_files/figure-html/r2-1-3.png){width=672} ::: ::: ## 3. White abalone example You’re working on white abalone conservation and you’re concerned about warming temperatures on abalone growth. You keep abalone in tanks at different temperatures that range from cold (10 °C) to warm (18 °C) for 4 weeks. You measure growth as the difference in mass between the beginning to the end of your experiment. How does water temperature affect abalone growth? ### a. generating the data ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} set.seed(666) abalone <- tibble( temperature = seq(from = 10, to = 18, by = 1), growth1 = runif(length(temperature), min = -0.7, max = -0.63)*temperature + runif(length(temperature), min = 15, max = 17), growth2 = runif(length(temperature), min = -0.7, max = -0.63)*temperature + runif(length(temperature), min = 15, max = 17), growth3 = runif(length(temperature), min = -0.7, max = -0.63)*temperature + runif(length(temperature), min = 15, max = 17) ) %>% pivot_longer(cols = growth1:growth3, names_to = "rep", values_to = "growth") %>% mutate(growth = round(growth, digits = 1)) %>% select(temperature, growth) # look at your data: head(abalone, 10) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 10 × 2 temperature growth 1 10 9.1 2 10 9.6 3 10 9.7 4 11 9 5 11 8.8 6 11 8.8 7 12 7.5 8 12 9.1 9 12 8.5 10 13 6.3 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(data = abalone, aes(x = temperature, y = growth)) + geom_point() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](lecture_week-07_files/figure-html/abalone-growth-data-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: Seems like there is a linear relationship between temperature and abalone growth. As temperature increases, abalone growth decreases. ### b. fitting a model ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} abalone_model <- lm(growth ~ temperature, data = abalone) # just checking DHARMa residuals just in case DHARMa::simulateResiduals(abalone_model, plot = TRUE) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](lecture_week-07_files/figure-html/abalone-model-and-checks-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Object of Class DHARMa with simulated residuals based on 250 simulations with refit = FALSE . See ?DHARMa::simulateResiduals for help. Scaled residual values: 0.328 0.604 0.656 0.62 0.548 0.472 0.228 0.976 0.716 0.052 0.496 0.528 0.128 0.132 0.92 0.352 0.684 0.152 0.98 0.764 ... ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # base R residuals par(mfrow = c(2, 2)) plot(abalone_model) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](lecture_week-07_files/figure-html/abalone-model-and-checks-2.png){width=672} ::: ::: ### c. looking at model coefficients ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} summary(abalone_model) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Call: lm(formula = growth ~ temperature, data = abalone) Residuals: Min 1Q Median 3Q Max -1.15370 -0.50093 0.06019 0.34491 1.24630 Coefficients: Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|) (Intercept) 16.40926 0.69633 23.57 < 2e-16 *** temperature -0.69722 0.04891 -14.25 1.65e-13 *** --- Signif. codes: 0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 Residual standard error: 0.6562 on 25 degrees of freedom Multiple R-squared: 0.8904, Adjusted R-squared: 0.8861 F-statistic: 203.2 on 1 and 25 DF, p-value: 1.65e-13 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # common way of representing model summaries # from flextable package flextable::as_flextable(abalone_model) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}

Estimate

Standard Error

t value

Pr(>|t|)

(Intercept)

F-statistic: 203.2 on 25 and 1 DF, p-value: 0.0000

``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # better table flextable::as_flextable(abalone_model) %>% set_formatter(values = list("p.value" = function(x){ # special function to represent p < 0.001 z <- scales::label_pvalue()(x) z[!is.finite(x)] <- "" z })) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}

Multiple R-squared: 0.8904, Adjusted R-squared: 0.8861

F-statistic: 203.2 on 25 and 1 DF, p-value: 0.0000

``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # somewhat more customizable way # from modelsummary package modelsummary(abalone_model) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html} tinytable_2gyxaqhn45q40otzoh59
(1)

``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # better table modelsummary(list("Abalone model" = abalone_model), # naming the model fmt = 2, # rounding digits to 2 decimal places estimate = "{estimate} [{conf.low}, {conf.high}] ({p.value})", # customizing appearance statistic = NULL, # not displaying standard error gof_omit = 'DF|AIC|BIC|Log.Lik.|RMSE') # taking out some extraneous info ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html} tinytable_rj8md2mmzid7f92ng9fw
Abalone model
(Intercept) 16.41 [14.98, 17.84] (<0.01)
temperature -0.70 [-0.80, -0.60] (<0.01)

``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # using gtsummary package tbl_regression(abalone_model, intercept = TRUE) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
Characteristic Beta 95% CI1 p-value
(Intercept) 16 15, 18 <0.001
temperature -0.70 -0.80, -0.60 <0.001

``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # more customizing tbl_regression(abalone_model, # model object intercept = TRUE) %>% # show the intercept as_flex_table() # turn it into a flextable (easier to save) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}

Characteristic

1CI = Confidence Interval

``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} anova(abalone_model) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Analysis of Variance Table Response: growth Df Sum Sq Mean Sq F value Pr(>F) temperature 1 87.501 87.501 203.19 1.65e-13 *** Residuals 25 10.766 0.431 --- Signif. codes: 0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 ``` ::: ::: ### d. visualizing the model ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} model_preds <- ggpredict(abalone_model, terms = "temperature") # look at the output: model_preds ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # Predicted values of growth temperature | Predicted | 95% CI ------------------------------------ 10 | 9.44 | 8.96, 9.92 11 | 8.74 | 8.34, 9.14 12 | 8.04 | 7.71, 8.37 13 | 7.35 | 7.07, 7.62 14 | 6.65 | 6.39, 6.91 15 | 5.95 | 5.67, 6.23 16 | 5.25 | 4.92, 5.58 18 | 3.86 | 3.38, 4.34 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # plotting without 95% CI ggplot(abalone, # using the actual data aes(x = temperature, # x-axis y = growth)) + # y-axis geom_point(color = "cornflowerblue", # each point is an individual abalone size = 3) + # model prediction: actual model line geom_line(data = model_preds, # model prediction table aes(x = x, # x-axis y = predicted), # y-axis linewidth = 1) # line width ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](lecture_week-07_files/figure-html/abalone-plot-1.png){width=672} ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # plotting ggplot(abalone, # using the actual data aes(x = temperature, # x-axis y = growth)) + # y-axis # plot the data first # each point is an individual abalone geom_point(color = "cornflowerblue", size = 3) + # model prediction: 95% CI geom_ribbon(data = model_preds, # model prediction table aes(x = x, # x-axis y = predicted, # y-axis ymin = conf.low, # lower bound of 95% CI ymax = conf.high), # upper bound of 95% CI alpha = 0.2) + # transparency) # model prediction: actual model line geom_line(data = model_preds, # model prediction table aes(x = x, # x-axis y = predicted), # y-axis linewidth = 1) # line width ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](lecture_week-07_files/figure-html/abalone-plot-2.png){width=672} ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # compare with: ggplot(abalone, aes(x = temperature, y = growth)) + geom_point() + geom_smooth(method = "lm") ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](lecture_week-07_files/figure-html/abalone-plot-3.png){width=672} ::: ::: ### e. outliers ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} abalone %>% mutate(outlier = ifelse(row_number() %in% c(19, 21, 27), "yes", "no")) %>% ggplot(aes(x = temperature, y = growth)) + geom_point(aes(color = outlier), size = 3) + geom_line(data = model_preds, aes(x = x, y = predicted), linewidth = 1) + scale_color_manual(values = c("yes" = "red", "no" = "cornflowerblue")) + theme(legend.position = "none") ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](lecture_week-07_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-1-1.png){width=672} ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # new abalone data frame abalone2 <- abalone %>% slice(-c(19, 21, 27)) abalone_model2 <- lm(growth ~ temperature, data = abalone2) summary(abalone_model2) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Call: lm(formula = growth ~ temperature, data = abalone2) Residuals: Min 1Q Median 3Q Max -1.01641 -0.44359 0.08359 0.34163 1.05272 Coefficients: Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|) (Intercept) 16.81772 0.60270 27.90 < 2e-16 *** temperature -0.73087 0.04336 -16.85 4.61e-14 *** --- Signif. codes: 0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 Residual standard error: 0.537 on 22 degrees of freedom Multiple R-squared: 0.9281, Adjusted R-squared: 0.9249 F-statistic: 284.1 on 1 and 22 DF, p-value: 4.606e-14 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} model_preds2 <- ggpredict(abalone_model2, terms = "temperature") ggplot(data = abalone2, aes(x = temperature, y = growth)) + geom_point(color = "cornflowerblue", size = 3) + geom_line(data = model_preds2, aes(x = x, y = predicted), linewidth = 1) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](lecture_week-07_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-1-2.png){width=672} ::: ::: ## 4. Exponential growth example To compare with abalone example ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} df_ex <- tibble( x = seq(from = 10, to = 18, length = 27), y = c(15, 15, 15, 15, 14.3, 14.2, 14.1, 14, 13.9, 13.9, 13.8, 13.7, 13.2, 13.1, 13, 12.5, 11.1, 10, 9.9, 7, 5, 3, 1.7, 1, 0.5, 0.3, 0.1) ) lm_ex <- lm(y ~ x, data = df_ex) summary(lm_ex) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Call: lm(formula = y ~ x, data = df_ex) Residuals: Min 1Q Median 3Q Max -3.2540 -2.0605 -0.4009 2.3533 3.6288 Coefficients: Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|) (Intercept) 38.5833 2.6772 14.41 1.29e-13 *** x -2.0329 0.1885 -10.79 6.82e-11 *** --- Signif. codes: 0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 Residual standard error: 2.347 on 25 degrees of freedom Multiple R-squared: 0.8231, Adjusted R-squared: 0.816 F-statistic: 116.3 on 1 and 25 DF, p-value: 6.823e-11 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(data = df_ex, aes(x = x, y = y)) + geom_point() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](lecture_week-07_files/figure-html/exp-data-and-model-1.png){width=672} ::: ```{.r .cell-code} lm_pred <- ggpredict(lm_ex, terms = ~x) ex_plot_noline <- ggplot(df_ex, aes(x= x, y = y)) + geom_point(size = 3, color = "orange") + theme_classic() + theme(text = element_text(size = 14)) ex_plot_noline ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](lecture_week-07_files/figure-html/exp-data-and-model-2.png){width=672} ::: ```{.r .cell-code} ex_plot <- ggplot(df_ex, aes(x= x, y = y)) + geom_point(size = 3, color = "orange") + geom_line(data = lm_pred, aes(x = x, y = predicted), linewidth = 1) + theme(text = element_text(size = 14)) ex_plot ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](lecture_week-07_files/figure-html/exp-data-and-model-3.png){width=672} ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} par(mfrow = c(2, 2)) plot(lm_ex) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](lecture_week-07_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-2-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # if using quarto, don't label chunk with a table... so weird anova_tbl <- broom::tidy(anova(model1)) %>% mutate(across(where(is.numeric), ~ round(.x, digits = 2))) %>% mutate(p.value = case_when( p.value < 0.001 ~ "< 0.001" )) flextable(anova_tbl) %>% set_header_labels(term = "Term", df = "Degrees of freedom", sumsq = "Sum of squares", meansq = "Mean squares", statistic = "F-statistic", p.value = "p-value") %>% set_table_properties(layout = "autofit", width = 0.8) ``` ::: # 5. Temperature/elevation example ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # data sonadora <- read_csv(here::here("data", "knb-lter-luq.183.877108", "Temp_SonadoraGradient_Daily.csv")) # cleaning sonadora_clean <- sonadora %>% janitor::clean_names() %>% pivot_longer(cols = plot_250:plot_1000, names_to = "plot_name", values_to = "temp_c") %>% separate_wider_delim(cols = plot_name, delim = "_", names = c("plot", "elevation_m"), cols_remove = FALSE) %>% select(-plot) %>% mutate(elevation_m = as.numeric(elevation_m)) # summarizing sonadora_sum <- sonadora_clean %>% group_by(plot_name, elevation_m) %>% reframe(mean_temp_c = mean(temp_c, na.rm = TRUE)) %>% arrange(elevation_m) # model model <- lm(mean_temp_c ~ elevation_m, data = sonadora_sum) # visualization ggplot(data = sonadora_sum, aes(x = elevation_m, y = mean_temp_c)) + geom_point(size = 3) + labs(x = "Elevation (m)", y = "Temperature (°C)") ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](lecture_week-07_files/figure-html/sonadora-temperature-1.png){width=672} ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # diagnostics from DHARMa DHARMa::simulateResiduals(model, plot = TRUE) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](lecture_week-07_files/figure-html/sonadora-temperature-2.png){width=672} ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Object of Class DHARMa with simulated residuals based on 250 simulations with refit = FALSE . See ?DHARMa::simulateResiduals for help. Scaled residual values: 0.484 0.476 0.264 0.764 0.472 0.36 0.336 0.396 0.564 0.44 0.548 0.792 0.856 0.948 0.604 0 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # summary summary(model) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Call: lm(formula = mean_temp_c ~ elevation_m, data = sonadora_sum) Residuals: Min 1Q Median 3Q Max -0.67288 -0.07577 0.00022 0.09393 0.37042 Coefficients: Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|) (Intercept) 24.7807991 0.1719438 144.12 < 2e-16 *** elevation_m -0.0055446 0.0002581 -21.48 4.08e-12 *** --- Signif. codes: 0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 Residual standard error: 0.238 on 14 degrees of freedom Multiple R-squared: 0.9706, Adjusted R-squared: 0.9684 F-statistic: 461.4 on 1 and 14 DF, p-value: 4.075e-12 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} tidy(model) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 2 × 5 term estimate std.error statistic p.value 1 (Intercept) 24.8 0.172 144. 1.32e-23 2 elevation_m -0.00554 0.000258 -21.5 4.08e-12 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # model predictions ggpredict(model) %>% plot(show_data = TRUE) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](lecture_week-07_files/figure-html/sonadora-temperature-3.png){width=672} ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # diagnostics par(mfrow = c(2, 2)) plot(model) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](lecture_week-07_files/figure-html/sonadora-diagnostics-1.png){width=1152} ::: ::: # 6. correlation ### a. abalone correlation ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} cor.test(abalone$growth, abalone$temperature, method = "pearson") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Pearson's product-moment correlation data: abalone$growth and abalone$temperature t = -14.254, df = 25, p-value = 1.65e-13 alternative hypothesis: true correlation is not equal to 0 95 percent confidence interval: -0.9742769 -0.8787221 sample estimates: cor -0.9436321 ``` ::: ::: ### b. correlation but different slopes ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} corr_df <- tibble( x = seq(from = 1, to = 10, by = 0.5), y1 = 0.25*x, y2 = 1*x ) corr_0.25 <- ggplot(data = corr_df, aes(x = x, y = y1)) + geom_point(size = 3) + scale_y_continuous(limits = c(0, 10)) corr_1 <- ggplot(data = corr_df, aes(x = x, y = y2)) + geom_point(size = 3) + scale_y_continuous(limits = c(0, 10)) corr_0.25 + corr_1 ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](lecture_week-07_files/figure-html/correlation-1.png){width=1152} ::: ::: ### c. no correlation but clear relationship ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} x_lm <- seq(from = 1, to = 30, length.out = 50) # y = a( x – h) 2 + k df_para <- cbind( x = x_lm, y = 0.1*(x_lm - 15)^2 + 12 ) %>% as_tibble() ggplot(data = df_para, aes(x = x, y = y)) + geom_point(size = 3) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](lecture_week-07_files/figure-html/parabola-1.png){width=672} ::: ```{.r .cell-code} cor.test(df_para$x, df_para$y, method = "pearson") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Pearson's product-moment correlation data: df_para$x and df_para$y t = 0.90749, df = 48, p-value = 0.3687 alternative hypothesis: true correlation is not equal to 0 95 percent confidence interval: -0.1540408 0.3939806 sample estimates: cor 0.1298756 ``` ::: ::: # exponential growth example ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} x_ex <- seq(from = 5, to = 9, length = 30) y_ex <- exp(x_ex) df_ex <- cbind( x = x_ex, y = -exp(x_ex) ) %>% as_tibble() lm_ex <- lm(y ~ x, data = df_ex) lm_ex ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Call: lm(formula = y ~ x, data = df_ex) Coefficients: (Intercept) x 9431 -1642 ``` ::: ::: ## model summary ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} summary(lm_ex) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Call: lm(formula = y ~ x, data = df_ex) Residuals: Min 1Q Median 3Q Max -2756.1 -660.5 226.3 843.2 1081.0 Coefficients: Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|) (Intercept) 9431.3 1111.3 8.486 3.16e-09 *** x -1642.0 156.5 -10.492 3.30e-11 *** --- Signif. codes: 0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 Residual standard error: 1023 on 28 degrees of freedom Multiple R-squared: 0.7972, Adjusted R-squared: 0.79 F-statistic: 110.1 on 1 and 28 DF, p-value: 3.298e-11 ``` ::: ::: ## model plots ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} lm_pred <- ggpredict(lm_ex, terms = ~x) ex_plot_noline <- ggplot(df_ex, aes(x= x, y = y)) + geom_point(shape = 17, size = 3, color = "orange") + theme_classic() + theme(text = element_text(size = 14)) ex_plot <- ggplot(df_ex, aes(x= x, y = y)) + geom_point(shape = 17, size = 3, color = "orange") + geom_line(data = lm_pred, aes(x = x, y = predicted), linewidth = 1) + theme_classic() + theme(text = element_text(size = 14)) ``` ::: # diagnostic plots ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} par(mfrow = c(2, 4)) plot(model1, which = c(1), col = "cornflowerblue", pch = 19) plot(lm_ex, which = c(1), col = "orange", pch = 17) plot(model1, which = c(2), col = "cornflowerblue", pch = 19) plot(lm_ex, which = c(2), col = "orange", pch = 17) plot(model1, which = c(3), col = "cornflowerblue", pch = 19) plot(lm_ex, which = c(3), col = "orange", pch = 17) plot(model1, which = c(5), col = "cornflowerblue", pch = 19) plot(lm_ex, which = c(5), col = "orange", pch = 17) dev.off() ``` :::
